solution.text:
We have, \(x=-_{j}_\) and \(x=-_{k}_\) are the zeroes of the equation.
\(\Rightarrow (x+_{j}_) \) and \( (x+_{k}_) \) are the factors of the equations
Also,\(\Rightarrow (x+_{j}_) \times (x+_{k}_) =x^2+_{{j+k}}_x+_{{j*k}}_\) are the factors of the equations
To get other factors of the equation we divide \(x^4+_{{j+k+l+m}}_x^3+_{{(l+m)*(k+j)+l*m+j*k}}_x^2+_{{(l+m)*j*k+l*m*(j+k)}}_x+_{{j*k*l*m}}_\) by \(x^2+_{{j+k}}_x+_{{j*k}}_\)
\(\require{enclose}\begin{array}{r} x^2+_{{l+m}}_x+_{{l*m}}_ \\[-3pt] x^2+_{{j+k}}_x+_{{j*k}}_\enclose{longdiv}{x^4+_{{j+k+l+m}}_x^3+_{{(l+m)*(k+j)+l*m+j*k}}_x^2+_{{(l+m)*j*k+l*m*(j+k)}}_x+_{{j*k*l*m}}_} \\[-3pt] \underline{x^4+_{{j+k}}_x^3+_{{j*k}}_x^2\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,}\phantom{2} \\[-3pt] _{{l+m}}_x^3+_{{(l+m)*(k+j)+l*m}}_x^2+_{{(l+m)*j*k+l*m*(j+k)}}_x+_{{j*k*l*m}}_ \\[-3pt] \underline{_{{l+m}}_x^3+_{{(l+m)*(j+k)}}_x^2+_{{(l+m)*j*k}}_x}\phantom{2}\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \\[-3pt] _{{l*m}}_x^2+_{{(k+j)*l*m}}_x+_{{j*k*l*m}}_ \\[-3pt] \underline{_{{l*m}}_x^2+_{{(k+j)*l*m}}_x+_{{j*k*l*m}}_}\phantom{2} \\[-3pt] 0\,\,\,\end{array}\)
On dividing we get remainder as 0 and quotient as \(x^2+_{{m+l}}_x+_{{l*m}}_\)
Factorizing the above equation \((x+_{l}_)(x+_{m}_)\)
Hence the other two zeroes are, \(x=-_{l}_\) and \(x=-_{m}_\) and sum of the two zeroes \(=-_{{l+m}}_\)

content.text:
If (-_{j}_) and (-_{k}_) are the zeroes of the equation \(x^4+_{{j+k+l+m}}_x^3+_{{(l+m)*(k+j)+l*m+j*k}}_x^2+_{{(l+m)*j*k+l*m*(j+k)}}_x+_{{j*k*l*m}}_\)
Find sum of the other two zeroes of the equation.
